data.text: Nearly one-third of people who have been infected with COVID-19 reported at least one on-going symptom six to 12 months after their diagnosis, a survey of 152,000 people by the State Serum Institute of Denmark found.
The U.S. Food and Drug Administration rejected the application for emergency authorization of an India-made COVID-19 vaccine for children 2-18, the American pharmaceutical company Ocugen said Friday.
The U.S. state of New Jersey’s governor said Friday that he will lift the state’s public health emergency next week.

The Biden administration can no longer expel migrant families from the U.S. under a pandemic-era public-health rule if they will be returned to a country where they face persecution, an appeals court ruled Friday.

A convoy of truckers is expected to arrive in the Washington, D.C. area this weekend to protest COVID-19 vaccine and mask mandates implemented during the pandemic.  The “People’s Convoy” started their journey in Barstow, California early last week.

The complaint was filed in partnership with the Federal Trade Commission who seek to impose civil penalties, alleging the company used misinformation to exploit fears during the pandemic, and “posed a significant risk to public health safety.”
